Change-Id: Ic486a9f72820df2e0a48a18166f043e5ddb5bd0a
Closes-Bug: #1688519
"}]
commit_message:
Fix iSCSI mounts for Cinder backup container

Cinder backup requires iSCSI volume and host mount for backing
any iSCSI volume, not only from LVM backend. 'enable_iscsid' is
a catch-all setting for all iSCSI backends that also runs
necessary iSCSI client on the same host.

Change-Id: Ic486a9f72820df2e0a48a18166f043e5ddb5bd0a
Closes-Bug: #1688519
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/12/462912/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - "{% if enable_iscsid | bool %}cinder:/var/lib/cinder{% endif %}" - "{% if enable_iscsid | bool %}iscsi_info:/etc/iscsi{% endif %}"
deleted_lines: - "{% if enable_cinder_backend_lvm | bool %}cinder:/var/lib/cinder{% endif %}" - "{% if enable_cinder_backend_lvm | bool %}iscsi_info:/etc/iscsi{% endif %}"

commit_message:
Basic script for pack-based build image

Each review which adds support for another plugin should change
the support matrix defined in the script.

Add the binary dependencies required for the sahara-image-pack
command.

Change-Id: Ibc294bd572ee4da298f125f9d9c4bff87ce5da9d

commit_message:
Fix kuryr devstack systemd unit file issues

This commit fixes several unit file related issues on kuryr devstack
plugin.

- drops 'sudo' from Execstart
- adds full path to commands in order to avoid unit file issues
- handles dockerd path
- wraps run_process to use root user instead of stack

Change-Id: If585d3f33eed5e7488212157a763d217a7b7c4bd
Co-Authored-By: Frederick F. Kautz IV <fkautz@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug:1688300
Closes-Bug:1688346

commit_message:
Get endpoint versions with domain scope session

Session.get_endpoint() failed when using domain scope
authentcation, that cause by missing of project id in auth,
that is regluar use case for admin to operate the resource
(user, project, role and so on) of identity service with
domain scope token. This patch fix the issue.

Change-Id: I7f1f656918f6bfc1ea7333c49b97003022184d99
Closes-Bug: #1688241
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/32/462832/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test__get_endpoint_versions_with_domain_scope(self): # This test covers a common case of services deployed under # subdomains. Additionally, it covers the case of getting endpoint # versions with domain scope token sc_uri = "https://service.cloud.com/identity" versions_uri = "https://service.cloud.com" sot = session.Session(None) # Project id is None when domain scope session present sot.get_project_id = mock.Mock(return_value=None) responses = [session.Session._Endpoint(versions_uri, "versions")] sot._parse_versions_response = mock.Mock(side_effect=responses) result = sot._get_endpoint_versions("type", sc_uri) sot._parse_versions_response.assert_called_once_with(versions_uri) self.assertEqual(result, responses[0]) self.assertFalse(result.needs_project_id) self.assertIsNone(result.project_id)

commit_message:
Add sync traits command for placement

Add 'placement-manage traits sync' command to update os-traits
library to database. Default behavior is to only insert newly
added traits and remove standard traits not associated with
resource providers, if '--force' is specified, any outdated
trait will be deleted no matter if it's associated.

Partially-Implements: blueprint resource-provider-traits

Change-Id: I227615da88ae0efe4b6ca3778cb08f9029297f3a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/25/450125/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: placement-manage = nova.cmd.placement_manage:main

subject: XenAPI: fix memory usage miscalculation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-08 09:38:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/21a4e6d3f46fbdfba3d4e766945d90b0f571750e', 'message': 'WIP: fix memory usage miscalculation

Resource tracker will always overwrite the used host memory info provided by
hypervisor with the reserved memory read from nova conf. So the real memory
consumptions(in spite of instances) cannot reflect on this data.

Change-Id: I22e5a8fcea870c508f3451337e6be91371fe7aa5
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-09 03:57:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a309580e33c007f08f9b28ba8f6d4e7d3f512143', 'message': 'WIP: fix memory usage miscalculation

Resource tracker will always overwrite the used host memory info provided by
hypervisor with the reserved memory read from nova conf. So the real memory
consumptions(in spite of instances) cannot reflect on this data.

Change-Id: I22e5a8fcea870c508f3451337e6be91371fe7aa5
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-16 09:37:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/cd62ad5b16b3d2f7a49c0a8c26ac525968ea5311', 'message': "WIP: fix memory usage miscalculation

Resource tracker will always overwrite the used host memory info provided by
hypervisor with the reserved memory read from nova conf. So the real memory
consumptions(in spite of instances) cannot reflect on this data. Another part
of this fix is the instances' memory usage should be excluded from host used
memory because we don't want to repetitively add it.

Change-Id: I22e5a8fcea870c508f3451337e6be91371fe7aa5
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-17 07:57:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3bc27fdc5bfad3c88c57006ba7376d53d2e8b737', 'message': "WIP: fix memory usage miscalculation

Resource tracker will always overwrite the used host memory info provided by
hypervisor with the reserved memory read from nova conf. So the real memory
usage(may be comsumed by other VMs) cannot reflect on resource report. And
scheduler may proceed instance's claiming even when there actually isn't enough
free memory.

This fix proposes to add a new method to virt drivers so they can report a
dynamic reserved memory. Resource tracker will compare it with the staticly
configured reserved memory and pick up the larger one. So the backward
compatability will also be guaranteed.

Change-Id: I22e5a8fcea870c508f3451337e6be91371fe7aa5
Closes-Bug: #1642494
"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-11-17 09:01:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/1373d0a21bc1950abb99b8568fcd57e331d94732', 'message': "WIP: fix memory usage miscalculation

commit_message:
XenAPI: fix memory usage miscalculation

Although hypervisor will report the used memory to resource tracker, but
resource tracker won't use that value. Instead it will calculate the
used memory basing the reserved memory and memory used by intances. This
calculation doesn't count the memory used by the hypervisor itself (dom0
in XenServer) and also doesn't count the memory used by VMs which were
booted outside of OpenStack (e.g. the compute/controller nodes running
on the hosts). So scheduler may proceed instance's claiming even when
there actually isn't enough free memory.

This fix proposes to add a new method to virt drivers so they can report
a dynamic reserved memory which include the memory has been used by VMs
which were booted outside of OpenStack. Resource tracker will compare it
with the staticly configured reserved memory and pick up the larger one.
So the backward compatability will also be guaranteed.

Change-Id: I22e5a8fcea870c508f3451337e6be91371fe7aa5
Closes-Bug: #1642494

commit_message:
Refactor install-guide: integration with other services

* Group all topics related to other services under one heading
* Move multitenancy configuration to the install-guide
* Remove useless page on configuring port groups
* Fix titles to be more consistent (e.g. when talking about services)
* Use separate pages instead of includes.
* Move deploy ramdisk section up, as it's used in enrollment

Change-Id: I675d201b0acf1cf3acb4eafeafb8eb9628fd10f5

commit_message:
Make devstack fail early for common systemd pitfalls

There are a couple of issues that have ended up being hit by devstack
plugin authors which we can detect and error in a much nicer way
instead of them having a cryptic systemd failure.

Change-Id: I45e4ac363aeefb4503015f9e1b57c58f79b58f40
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/78/462678/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function _common_systemd_pitfalls { local cmd=$1 # do some sanity checks on $cmd to see things we don't expect to work if [[ "$cmd" =~ "sudo" ]]; then local msg=<<EOF You are trying to use run_process with sudo, this is not going to work under systemd. If you need to run a service as a user other than $STACK_USER call it with: run_process \$name \$cmd \$group \$user EOF die $LINENO $msg fi if [[ ! "$cmd" =~ ^/ ]]; then local msg=<<EOF The cmd="$cmd" does not start with an absolute path. It will fail to start under systemd. Please update your run_process stanza to have an absolute path. EOF die $LINENO $msg fi } # Helper function to build a basic unit file and run it under systemd. # sanity check the command _common_systemd_pitfalls "$cmd" # run_process service "command-line" [group] [user]
deleted_lines: # run_process service "command-line" [group]

commit_message:

commit_message:
devstack: fix gobgp installation

* use GOPATH instead of custom GO_DIR
* better use of defaults

Change-Id: I6109d47d4f5690b3032b3e295f0b4c1ab5faa6c4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe refs/changes/66/462866/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export GOPATH=${GOPATH:-$DEST/go} if [[ ! -d $GOPATH ]]; then mkdir -p $GOPATH # Install gobgp go get ${GOBGP_REPO:-github.com/osrg/gobgp}/gobgpd go get ${GOBGP_REPO:-github.com/osrg/gobgp}/gobgp
deleted_lines: if [[ ! -d $GO_DIR ]]; then mkdir -p $GO_DIR # Install gobgp go get $GOBGP_REPO/gobgpd go get $GOBGP_REPO/gobgp

commit_message:
Using text/plain for error responses

This prevents XSS attacks injecting scripts to error messages. Currently
http error constructor sets content-type to text/html for errors with
the code 500.

Change-Id: I21b5855ebe102060f4046706b5c6ab2e3e532162
Closes-Bug: #1583602
(cherry picked from commit 25fca4bb847bf6e16b0a0c7c35437b7a478e81b1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/26/332026/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: web.header('Content-Type', 'text/plain')

commit_message:
swift: make sure to retry if the client cannot find Swift

The following can happen:

2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 CRITICAL gnocchi [-] ClientException: Endpoint for object-store not found - have you specified a region?
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi Traceback (most recent call last):
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi   File "/usr/bin/gnocchi-statsd", line 10, in <module>
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi     sys.exit(statsd())
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/cli.py", line 74, in statsd
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi     statsd_service.start()
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/statsd.py", line 174, in start
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi     stats = Stats(conf)
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/statsd.py", line 38, in __init__
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi     self.storage = storage.get_driver(self.conf)
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/__init__.py", line 158, in get_driver
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi     return get_driver_class(conf)(conf.storage)
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gnocchi/storage/swift.py", line 98, in __init__
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi     self.swift.put_container(self.MEASURE_PREFIX)
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/swiftclient/client.py", line 1728, in put_container
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi     query_string=query_string)
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/swiftclient/client.py", line 1635, in _retry
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi     self.url, self.token = self.get_auth()
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/swiftclient/client.py", line 1587, in get_auth
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi     timeout=self.timeout)
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/swiftclient/client.py", line 662, in get_auth
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi     auth_version=auth_version)
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/swiftclient/client.py", line 596, in get_auth_keystone
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi     'have you specified a region?' % service_type)
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi ClientException: Endpoint for object-store not found - have you specified a region?
2017-05-02 15:21:24.363 96139 ERROR gnocchi

Make sure we retry.

Change-Id: I12ad167962aa62c22785c32394a607929ca8b925
(cherry picked from commit d81f13dc9f33953ba4cb9ec1a5f28944193011c0)

commit_message:
Kuryr-libnetwork Docker managed plugin

This patch add a script to create v2plugin rootfs.
1. use local unix socket for v2plugin
2. add config.json for v2plugin
3. Add scripts to build v2plugin rootfs
4. Update devstack to use v2plugin

Change-Id: I91d352a963840f33d1d2f9cea17ab6ac777d22bc
Related-Bug: #1668486
Partially-Implements: BP docker-v2plugin

subject: Ignore more non-device related filesystems
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-04 12:23:32.000000000', 'files': ['conf.d/disk.yaml', 'monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/disk.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent/commit/c0c5b9b1c17ffb8571e6c5bd6d152776ad4ea1ed', 'message': "Ignore more non-device related filesystems

The blacklist wasn't really accurate on any recent system anymore
because many more additional filesystems are being implemented these
days (examples: mqueue, binfmt_misc, systemd-1, ...). Instead of
hardcoding all of them, simply ignore all nodev filesystems.

Change-Id: I1fc42ae700475d51e1daf1ed79c6e223532da1d9
(cherry picked from commit 2988905a9f3cb75c9f160e0edb5d4bc4f4438985)
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore more non-device related filesystems

The blacklist wasn't really accurate on any recent system anymore
because many more additional filesystems are being implemented these
days (examples: mqueue, binfmt_misc, systemd-1, ...). Instead of
hardcoding all of them, simply ignore all nodev filesystems.

Change-Id: I1fc42ae700475d51e1daf1ed79c6e223532da1d9
(cherry picked from commit 2988905a9f3cb75c9f160e0edb5d4bc4f4438985)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/30/462530/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: fs_types_to_ignore = set() file_system_list = set() # automatically ignore filesystems not backed by a device try: for nodevfs in filter(lambda x: x.startswith('nodev\t'), file('/proc/filesystems')): file_system_list.add(nodevfs.partition('\t')[2].strip()) except IOError: log.debug('Failed reading /proc/filesystems') file_system_list.update(x.strip() for x in file_systems.split(','))
deleted_lines: fs_types_to_ignore = [] file_system_list = [] file_system_list.extend([x.strip() for x in file_systems.split(',')])

commit_message:
Set nodes' statuses to 'error' when their nodegroup is deleted

According to the bug below and the spec, we did not implement
one multirack feature aspect.

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/fuel-specs/specs/8.0/multi-rack-static.html#notifications-impact

Now we add resetting node to error to node group deletion callback and
send a notification.

Change-Id: I6b2bae5601ba7dbca620bb3861e95b0e554f8699
Closes-bug: #1644630
(cherry picked from commit cd2ee13830dbed7405cf5587c0fa30cf1f1f97fd)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/79/422179/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nailgun.rpc.receiver import NailgunReceiver release_kwargs={'version': '1111-9.0'}, @patch('nailgun.task.task.rpc.cast') @patch('objects.Notification.create') def test_delete_non_default_node_group_reset_node_to_error( self, _, notify): node_group = self.env.create_node_group(api=False, cluster_id=self.cluster.id) node2 = self.env.create_node(group_id=node_group.id, roles=['compute'], status=consts.NODE_STATUSES.provisioned, cluster_id=self.cluster.id) task = self.env.launch_deployment() NailgunReceiver.deploy_resp( task_uuid=task.uuid, status=consts.TASK_STATUSES.ready, progress=100, nodes=[{'uid': n.uid, 'status': consts.NODE_STATUSES.ready, 'progress': 100} for n in self.env.nodes], ) reset_task = self.env.reset_environment() NailgunReceiver.reset_environment_resp( task_uuid=reset_task.uuid, status=consts.TASK_STATUSES.ready, progress=100, nodes=[{'uid': n.uid} for n in self.env.nodes], ) self.env.delete_node_group(node_group.id) self.assertEqual(node2.status, consts.NODE_STATUSES.error) self.assertEqual(node2.error_type, consts.NODE_ERRORS.discover) notify.assert_called()
deleted_lines: release_kwargs={'version': '1111-8.0'},

commit_message:
Use keystone versionless endpoints

Nova requires Keystone endpoints to be versionless, currently quota and
some horizon features are broken on master.

Change-Id: I3792e2e61435090193c23425ddd438def02a666b

commit_message:
Simplify Node Ports fetching

This change introduces using Ironic API to fetch all ports
and combine them with Nodes. This greatly improves performance
of fetching Nodes, as it now requires 2 API calls rather than
N+1.

Change-Id: I2e38b8b8b948c20e05da6f846bf236b7633c7b85
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ui refs/changes/28/459628/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: getNodePorts(nodeUUID) { return this.defaultRequest(`/nodes/${nodeUUID}/ports`);

commit_message:
Don't set profile value to Role title

Profile value in NodesTable should list raw 'profile'
value rather than Role name. Node profile matches Node
to flavor (which is then matched to Role), so displaying
Role Name is not good especially due to the fact that
each deployment plan can have diferent set of Roles

Closes-Bug: 1680926
Change-Id: I77c9a2ac567a301b64f6c1ea02d6e04e7cdf1941

deleted_lines: cell={<NodesTableProfileCell data={filteredData} roles={this.props.roles}/>}/> nodesInProgress: ImmutablePropTypes.set.isRequired, roles: ImmutablePropTypes.map.isRequired if(profile) { const role = this.props.roles.get(profile); return role ? role.title : profile; } else { return '-'; } roles: ImmutablePropTypes.map.isRequired,

commit_message:
Remove NodesAssignment view/functionality

Due to the fact that Nodes tagging and Nodes assignment
are 2 separate steps where the tagging is not related
to deployment plan and assingment is setting actual
count of Nodes to deploy, these operations have been
moved into separate steps.

Closes-Bug: 1680871
Change-Id: Ided224d0dce350728b5b759141d42e06747b66a0

commit_message:
use MechanismDriver from neutron-lib

The ml2 MechanismDriver is now in neutron-lib along with its associated
constants. This patch switches over to the lib versions of those.

commit_message:
Handle CIDR IP address in allowed address pairs

A CIDR IP address in allowed address pairs causing init
and update operation failures on OFPort.
This is because those operations are not handling CIDR IP addresses.

This patch fixes that problem.

Change-Id: Ic4513859364403555e13593fb34bd2e58ea6377b
Closes-Bug: #1652729

commit_message:
Set clustertemplate:publish to admin only

Set the clustertemplate:publish policy to be admin only by default -
currently it is admin_or_user, which means any openstack user can create
a public cluster template.

Update tests for bay model and cluster template, splitting tests
requiring admin credentials into a separate class.

Change-Id: I0bfb57c569863f1ecf7d697cd5ac161a9a710432
Closes-Bug: #1687887
(cherry picked from commit 12052b1253782655397a26b1c50a0a2b7b539eaa)

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import testtools from magnum.tests.functional.api import base from magnum.tests.functional.common import datagen class ClusterTemplateAdminTest(base.BaseTempestTest): """Tests for clustertemplate admin operations.""" def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): super(ClusterTemplateAdminTest, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self.cluster_templates = [] self.cluster_template_client = None self.keypairs_client = None def setUp(self): try: super(ClusterTemplateAdminTest, self).setUp() (self.cluster_template_client, self.keypairs_client) = self.get_clients_with_new_creds( type_of_creds='admin', request_type='cluster_template') except Exception: self.tearDown() raise def tearDown(self): for cluster_template_id in self.cluster_templates: self._delete_cluster_template(cluster_template_id) self.cluster_templates.remove(cluster_template_id) super(ClusterTemplateAdminTest, self).tearDown() def _create_cluster_template(self, cmodel_model): resp, model = \ self.cluster_template_client.post_cluster_template(cmodel_model) self.assertEqual(201, resp.status) self.cluster_templates.append(model.uuid) return resp, model def _delete_cluster_template(self, model_id): resp, model = \ self.cluster_template_client.delete_cluster_template(model_id) self.assertEqual(204, resp.status) return resp, model @testtools.testcase.attr('positive') def test_create_get_public_cluster_template(self): gen_model = datagen.valid_swarm_cluster_template(is_public=True) resp, model = self._create_cluster_template(gen_model) resp, model = \ self.cluster_template_client.get_cluster_template(model.uuid) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertTrue(model.public) @testtools.testcase.attr('positive') def test_update_cluster_template_public_by_uuid(self): path = "/public" gen_model = \ datagen.cluster_template_data_with_valid_keypair_image_flavor() resp, old_model = self._create_cluster_template(gen_model) patch_model = datagen.cluster_template_replace_patch_data(path, value=True) resp, new_model = self.cluster_template_client.patch_cluster_template( old_model.uuid, patch_model) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) resp, model = self.cluster_template_client.get_cluster_template( new_model.uuid) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertTrue(model.public)

tempest scenario per gabbi HTTP call.

commit_message:
tempest: rework gabbi setup

The current approach is a bit hacky and create one
tempest scenario per gabbi HTTP call.

The side effect is that tests continue to run even the previous
one have fail.

This changes the approach by running gabbi to have one scenario
per yaml file from tempest point of view.

This will make easier to debug the scenario in case of failure.

Change-Id: Ice4be203798a222b4b521540e637fb6ec0c9c01e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/93/461993/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from gabbi import runner from gabbi import suitemaker from gabbi import utilsTEST_DIR = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), '..', '..', 'tests', 'functional_live', 'gabbits') TIMEOUT_SCALING_FACTOR = 5 def _do_test(self, filename): token = self.os_admin.auth_provider.get_token() url = self.os_admin.auth_provider.base_url( with file(os.path.join(TEST_DIR, filename)) as f: suite_dict = utils.load_yaml(f) suite_dict.setdefault('defaults', {})['ssl'] = require_ssl test_suite = suitemaker.test_suite_from_dict( loader=unittest.defaultTestLoader, test_base_name="gabbi", suite_dict=suite_dict, test_directory=TEST_DIR, host=host, port=port, fixture_module=None, intercept=None, prefix=prefix, handlers=runner.initialize_handlers([]), test_loader_name="tempest") # NOTE(sileht): We hide stdout/stderr and reraise the failure # manually, tempest will print it itself. with open(os.devnull, 'w') as stream: result = unittest.TextTestRunner( stream=stream, verbosity=0, failfast=True, ).run(test_suite) if not result.wasSuccessful(): failures = (result.errors + result.failures + result.unexpectedSuccesses) if failures: test, bt = failures[0] name = test.test_data.get('name', test.id()) msg = 'From test "%s" :\n%s' % (name, bt) self.fail(msg) self.assertTrue(result.wasSuccessful()) def test_maker(name, filename): def test(self): self._do_test(filename) test.__name__ = name return test # Create one scenario per yaml file for filename in os.listdir(TEST_DIR): if not filename.endswith('.yaml'): continue name = "test_%s" % filename[:-5].lower().replace("-", "_") setattr(GnocchiGabbiTest, name, test_maker(name, filename))

commit_message:
Add netcat package in sahara-engine image

Sahara-engine use netcat in the neutron namespace to build
a session when use_namespaces=true, see utils/ssh_remote.py
in sahara source code.

Change-Id: I8a90d33f0b7b902e059077c3b9fd32ba7b7d7df4
Related-Bug: #1687624
Closes-Bug: #1687602
(cherry picked from commit 66413c804699f47e078dec663c281c25ef3e08ca)

subject: [Devstack] Rework VMs connection logic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-05 09:15:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/e6cf79e712b1ca49b8cd9f6d08c03973c5f1ed84', 'message': "[Devstack] Rework VMs connection logic

Devstack currently plugs the simulated baremetal VMs into OVS using the
libvirt bridge driver, this caused a problem because libvirt unplugs the
VM from the network when it is turned off. To fix this an extra bridge
was added between the VM and OVS to allow the OVS port to persist even
when the VM was turned off. This patch replaces how the devstack
simulated baremetal VMs are plugged into OVS with a manually created tap
interface, this removes the need for an extra bridge, because manually
created tap interfaces aren't unplugged when the VM is turned off.

Allow to connect several interfaces to a node by setting
IRONIC_VM_INTERFACE_COUNT devstack variable.

Change-Id: I7d0249efc55edb4f3a69aaa5b101dd80df2a563f
Co-Authored-By: Vasyl Saienko <vsaienko@mirantis.com>
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-05 09:28:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/7f0a325b1932a76e0bbefab6671c56a74e5252c9', 'message': "[Devstack] Rework VMs connection logic

Devstack currently plugs the simulated baremetal VMs into OVS using the
libvirt bridge driver, this caused a problem because libvirt unplugs the
VM from the network when it is turned off. To fix this an extra bridge
was added between the VM and OVS to allow the OVS port to persist even
when the VM was turned off. This patch replaces how the devstack
simulated baremetal VMs are plugged into OVS with a manually created tap
interface, this removes the need for an extra bridge, because manually
created tap interfaces aren't unplugged when the VM is turned off.

Allow to connect several interfaces to a node by setting
IRONIC_VM_INTERFACE_COUNT devstack variable.

Change-Id: I7d0249efc55edb4f3a69aaa5b101dd80df2a563f
Co-Authored-By: Vasyl Saienko <vsaienko@mirantis.com>
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-04-18 21:17:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/10f0387ced9de20ebaea52abeced1d786676b129', 'message': "[Devstack] Rework VMs connection logic

Devstack currently plugs the simulated baremetal VMs into OVS using the
libvirt bridge driver, this caused a problem because libvirt unplugs the
VM from the network when it is turned off. To fix this an extra bridge
was added between the VM and OVS to allow the OVS port to persist even
when the VM was turned off. This patch replaces how the devstack
simulated baremetal VMs are plugged into OVS with a manually created tap
interface, this removes the need for an extra bridge, because manually
created tap interfaces aren't unplugged when the VM is turned off.

Allow to connect several interfaces to a node by setting
IRONIC_VM_INTERFACE_COUNT devstack variable.

commit_message:
[Devstack] Rework VMs connection logic

Devstack currently plugs the simulated baremetal VMs into OVS using the
libvirt bridge driver, this caused a problem because libvirt unplugs the
VM from the network when it is turned off. To fix this an extra bridge
was added between the VM and OVS to allow the OVS port to persist even
when the VM was turned off. This patch replaces how the devstack
simulated baremetal VMs are plugged into OVS with a manually created tap
interface, this removes the need for an extra bridge, because manually
created tap interfaces aren't unplugged when the VM is turned off.

Allow to connect several interfaces to a node by setting
IRONIC_VM_INTERFACE_COUNT devstack variable.

Change-Id: I7d0249efc55edb4f3a69aaa5b101dd80df2a563f
Co-Authored-By: Vasyl Saienko <vsaienko@mirantis.com>

deleted_lines: while getopts "n:c:m:d:a:b:e:E:p:o:f:l:L:N:" arg; do sudo brctl addbr br-$NAME sudo ip link set br-$NAME up sudo ovs-vsctl add-port $BRIDGE ovs-$NAME -- set Interface ovs-$NAME type=internal sudo ip link set ovs-$NAME up sudo brctl addif br-$NAME ovs-$NAME --bridge br-$NAME --disk-format $DISK_FORMAT $VM_LOGGING --engine $ENGINE $UEFI_OPTS $vm_opts >&2# echo mac VM_MAC=$(virsh dumpxml $NAME | grep "mac address" | head -1 | cut -d\' -f2) switch_id=$(ip link show dev $BRIDGE | egrep -o "ether [A-Za-z0-9:]+"|sed "s/ether\ //") echo $VM_MAC $VBMC_PORT $PDU_OUTLET $BRIDGE $switch_id ovs-$NAME

subject: Use assertIsNone(...) instead of assertEqual(None, ...).
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-04 02:09:54.000000000', 'files': ['magnumclient/tests/test_shell.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-magnumclient/commit/669c9428d8fa9c11964aa97d7fbb080701de629a', 'message': 'Use assertIsNone(...) instead of assertEqual(None, ...).

Ref£º   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#real-world-import-order-examples

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit test assertions
tend to give better messages for more specific assertions. As a result,
assertIsNone(...) is preferred over assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...),
and assertIsNotNone(...) is preferred over assertNotEqual(None, ...)
and assertIsNot(None, ...).

Change-Id: Idcf78fce02b01c41816a34efcb1264d69ce71706
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertIsNone(...) instead of assertEqual(None, ...).

Ref£º   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#real-world-import-order-examples

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit test assertions
tend to give better messages for more specific assertions. As a result,
assertIsNone(...) is preferred over assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(None, ...),
and assertIsNotNone(...) is preferred over assertNotEqual(None, ...)
and assertIsNot(None, ...).

Change-Id: Idcf78fce02b01c41816a34efcb1264d69ce71706

commit_message:
Add a convenience attribute for reportclient

We commonly have to refer to 'self.scheduler_client.reportclient' in the
code, and this long name makes for many ugly continued lines. This
shortens that reference, and makes the code cleaner and more readable.

Blueprint: placement-claims

Change-Id: Ia202e3d8c585b821eca88a01294df89b85aff2b3

subject: Optimise apt cache update task
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-02 10:18:13.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/designate_install.yml', 'meta/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_designate/commit/c9817c1b99844239956934887d82f9c303a6e669', 'message': "Optimise apt cache update task

The update of the apt cache and the package installation
can all be handled in a single task by providing the
package action plugin with the right parameters. This
removes an extra task to optimise execution.

Also, Ansible 2.x allows the package module to consume
the package list in the name parameter instead of using
a with_items loop which further optimises the execution.

The minimum Ansible version is raised to 2.2 due to a
known bug [1] in Ansible's apt module which does not
update the cache properly if the cache update and the
install are combined in a single task.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/1497

Change-Id: I51d051e1bd10a98e868afba4e11bd01c9d09c7a3
"}]
commit_message:
Optimise apt cache update task

The update of the apt cache and the package installation
can all be handled in a single task by providing the
package action plugin with the right parameters. This
removes an extra task to optimise execution.

Also, Ansible 2.x allows the package module to consume
the package list in the name parameter instead of using
a with_items loop which further optimises the execution.

The minimum Ansible version is raised to 2.2 due to a
known bug [1] in Ansible's apt module which does not
update the cache properly if the cache update and the
install are combined in a single task.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/1497

Change-Id: I51d051e1bd10a98e868afba4e11bd01c9d09c7a3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_designate refs/changes/15/461715/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: min_ansible_version: 2.2
deleted_lines: min_ansible_version: 2.0

commit_message:
Remove the extension check for os-quota-class-sets

The Nova API doesn't support extension anymore.
There is no way to disable any API in now nova.
so check for os-quota-class-sets is useless now

because we need keep backward compatible, so we can't
remove all code and keep the old logic there.

Partial-implement-blueprint api-no-more-extensions-pike

Change-Id: I9499403bf448b5a3406b7371241bd44ef5e7b2f1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/93/451193/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Make --cluster option required for ca-rotate

Otherwise, the following error with be shown:

$ magnum ca-rotate
ERROR: 'Namespace' object has no attribute 'bay'

Change-Id: I48c19ad585d3bcb863c5432fae6a6c8af358a21b
Closes-Bug: #1677393

Add the missing configuration when generating cloudkitty.conf

orchestrator_opts are missing when generating configuration file
using `tox -e genconfig`, this patch adds that.

commit_message:
Support multi-project in xjob

1. What is the problem
We utilize an admin user to operate resources in asynchronous job.
Currently the project of this user is pre-configured, so when this
user try to operate resources which do not belong to the configured
project, operation will fail.

2. What is the solution for the problem
During deployment, we create an admin user and assign admin role to
it in each projects that need to be operated. And in the codes, since
now we have project_id in job table, we can use this project_id to
retrieve an admin token, instead of using the pre-configured project_id.

3. What features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution
Support using different project_id according to the operated resources
to get admin token when running asynchronous job.

Change-Id: Id3eb464bc0573f96cecfa4700cc977e328054d10

commit_message:
[upstream] Governance - AUC and election activies

This patch first adds to mention the criteria for AUC status
which was first announced by User Committee during Barcelona Summit
and finally landed to User Committee Charter.

Also, emphasizing election activities regarding Board Directors,
Technical Committees, User Committees, and PTLs will imply that OpenStack
governance is made with community activities and votes.
Finding who were elected and reading the candidacy would be meaningful
as exercises.

Change-Id: If25ab2912dd14d681ed5e82726f1c16a0d78f80c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/02/461902/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - Find how the latest election for Board of Directors, TC and UC were processed with voting activities. .. note:: The followings are examples of previous election candidates and results. - `Board election page <https://www.openstack.org/election/>`_ - `2017 Individual Director election results <http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/foundation/2017-January/002449.html>`_ - `Ocata TC candidates and elected TC members <https://governance.openstack.org/election/results/ocata/tc.html>`_ - `2017 User Committee Election <http://civs.cs.cornell.edu/cgi-bin/results.pl?id=E_4ec37f2d06428110>`_ - `2017 User Committee Election results <http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/user-committee/2017-February/001725.html>`_- Each PTL candidate needs to submit PTL candidacy - PTL responsibilities - Manage day-to-day operations - Drive the program goals - Resolve technical disputes - More responsibilities are described in `here <https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/ptl.html>`_Active User Contributors (AUC) ============================== - Users with the following activities are recognized as AUC status: - Organizers of Official OpenStack User Groups - Active members and contributors to functional teams and/or working groups - Moderators of any of the operators official meet-up sessions - Contributors to the repository under the UC governance - Track chairs for OpenStack summits - Contributors to Superuser - Active moderators on ask.openstack.org .. note:: - `OpenStack User Committee Charter <https://governance.openstack.org/uc/reference/charter.html>`_ - Determine who the PTL is for your favorite project currently, read the PTL candidacy, and figure out the project goals with priorities.. note:: - `Pike PTL results with candidacy <https://governance.openstack.org/election/results/pike/ptl.html>`_
deleted_lines: - Further details are in a later session- Manage day-to-day operations - Drive the program goals - Resolve technical disputes- Determine who the PTL is for your favorite project

commit_message:
[ceph] Employ radosgw built-in frontend

As of firefly (v0.80), ceph object gateway is running on civetweb
(embedded into the ceph-radosgw daemon) instead of apache and fastcgi.
Using civetweb simplifies the ceph object gateway installation and
configuration.

Change-Id: Idba61e094390e3c75a6e5d9b35a8e8e47a2a696f
Closes-Bug: #1671808
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/46/445946/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: frontend_type => 'civetweb', rgw_frontends => 'civetweb port=7480',
deleted_lines: include ::tweaks::apache_wrappers frontend_type => 'apache-proxy-fcgi', ceph::rgw::apache_proxy_fcgi { $gateway_name: docroot => '/var/www/radosgw', rgw_port => '6780', apache_purge_configs => false, apache_purge_vhost => false, custom_apache_ports => hiera_array('apache_ports', ['0.0.0.0:80']), }

commit_message:
[upstream] systemd instead of screen for DevStack

This updates the code-devstack slides to explain how
to use systemd instead of screen.  It notes that sceen
is now deprecated.  The exercise has been updated to
use systemd instead of screen.

Change-Id: Ie63249c98044b90bd64aa19a730792f26a2f7e3f
Co-Authored-By: Mars Toktonaliev <mars.toktonaliev@nokia.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jay S. Bryant <jsbryant@electronicjungle.net>

commit_message:
Support magnum-conductor multiple process workers

Multiple process workers support for magnum-conductor.
Adds new option 'workers' to group [conductor] of magnum.conf.

Change-Id: If4d47769c97f756dbf5f45ac4413df7971731f21
Implements: blueprint magnum-multiple-process-workers
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/38/414838/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_concurrency import processutils workers = CONF.conductor.num_conductor_workers if not workers: workers = processutils.get_worker_count() launcher = service.launch(CONF, server, workers=workers)
deleted_lines: launcher = service.launch(CONF, server)

commit_message:
Fix for Group API update to include check policy

All cinder APIs should do policy checks to enforce
role based access controls. All group apis except
groups update has this in place. This changeset
adds policy check for the update groups api.

Adds policy check for create_group_snapshot
Adds policy check for reset_status
Updates unit testcases

Change-Id: I36d3c929709b82cf5f34f681a2e1c34bba9feef9
Closes-Bug: 1676278
(cherry picked from commit f8088946b595184cc714b299bc8d7b0a475b1738)

deleted_lines: check_policy(context, 'reset_status')

commit_message:
Always have ./clean.sh run ./unstack.sh

There was detection code in clean.sh to only run it if a screen
session was found, but in systemd world, that's obviously not
true. This was causing me (and others) substantial confusion.

Change-Id: I204e94cd86b8c67012aabfca74796e593151c3a4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/27/462727/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Let unstack.sh do its thing first $TOP_DIR/unstack.sh --all
deleted_lines: # See if there is anything running... # need to adapt when run_service is merged SESSION=$(screen -ls | awk '/[0-9].stack/ { print $1 }') if [[ -n "$SESSION" ]]; then # Let unstack.sh do its thing first $TOP_DIR/unstack.sh --all fi

commit_message:
Dynamic port groups support

This spec is about update ironic/neutron integration to make
dynamic port groups available.

Change-Id: I1dc26137999e16f8ada7e09b1301b121cfc99d0a
Related-Bug: #1652630
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/03/415003/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================== Dynamic port groups =================== https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1652630 Today, Ironic allows to group ironic ports into port groups. Administrator also has ability to specify mode and properties of this port group by using appropriate portgroup fields. However administrator still required to pre-create a port group on the ToR (Top of the Rack Switch) manually. Problem description =================== While Ironic gives ability to create port groups with different configurations (mode and properties). However changes to ToR are still applied in manual fashion. To made port groups dynamic few things should be addressed: * Ironic should pass port group settings to Neutron ML2 drivers. They are be responsible to create specified port group on the ToR switch. * Mechanism to define port group configuration for end user should be defined. This spec is a start point and only describes how to solve item 1 in the list above. This spec is not cover end-user interface for specifying port group configuration at this moment, while can be extended when community has some agreements on it. Proposed change =============== Introduce a new config boolean option ``[neutron]/dynamic_portgroups`` that is a trigger to specify if dynamic port groups are supported in the cloud. Pass portgroup ``mode`` and ``properties`` in ``local_link_information`` dictionary to Neutron. Appropriate Neutron ML2 drivers will use that information to create port group dynamically on the ToR switch. Alternatives ------------ Use port groups in the static fashion. Data model impact ----------------- None. State Machine Impact -------------------- None. REST API impact --------------- None. Client (CLI) impact ------------------- None. RPC API impact -------------- None. Driver API impact ----------------- None. Nova driver impact ------------------ None. Ramdisk impact -------------- None. Security impact --------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Scalability impact ------------------ None. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- No need to pre-create port group at the ToR switch. Only need to specify port-group configuration at the Ironic portgroup object. Developer impact ---------------- Out of tree network interfaces should be updated to pass ``portgroup.mode`` and ``portgroup.properties`` with ``local_link_information`` to Neutron. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- vsaienko <vsaienko@mirantis.com> And hopefully many others! :) Work Items ---------- * Update ``neutron`` network interface to pass portgroup ``properties`` and ``mode`` in ``local_link_information`` dictionary to Neutron. * Add dynamic portgroup support to networking-generic-switch * Update tempest with appropriate tests. Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= * Add dynamic portgroup support to networking-generic-switch * Update tempest with appropriate tests. Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== Backward compatibility is retained as dynamic port groups are enabled via a new ``[neutron]/dynamic_portgroups`` config option. Documentation Impact ==================== This feature will be fully documented. References ========== * https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/networking/bonding.txt

commit_message:
Add some hacking checks borrowed from neutron

- [O343] Python 3: do not use basestring.
- [O344] Python 3: do not use dict.iteritems.
- [O345] Usage of Python eventlet module not allowed

Change-Id: I0d70bbc4608cc08f0944b836814462acdcf7269f

commit_message:
Add StackUpdateType to set hiera on upgrade

This will enable those consuming the stack_update_type hieradata
set by this parameter to differentiate an update from a major upgrade

Change-Id: I38469f4b7d04165ea5371aeb0cbd2e9349d70c79

commit_message:
Add missing IPs validation to test_rebuild_server

The test_rebuild_server test verifies several properties in a server
that has been rebuilt, however the IP addresses are never checked,
and after a rebuild the IP addresses should not change, so they should
be validated also by this test. This commit adds that validation to the
test.

Change-Id: If4baf51f1d36fb2298a01c28f6d55f851533cac4
Closes-Bug: 1600372
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/19/339819/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Get the IPs the server has before rebuilding it original_addresses = (self.client.show_server(self.server_id)['server'] ['addresses']) self.assertEqual(original_addresses, server['addresses'])

commit_message:
Move _get_marker_obj() out of CommonDbMixin.

This refactoring is a step towards the goal of removing the
CommonDbMixin mixin class.

Related-Blueprint: neutron-lib

Change-Id: I1e2da0687310cc2da767dc2a6d13500307bba1ee

deleted_lines: def _get_marker_obj(self, context, resource, limit, marker): if limit and marker: return getattr(self, '_get_%s' % resource)(context, marker) return None

commit_message:
Remove log translations from octavia

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

This patch also adds hacking rules for the translation tags.

See: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Co-Authored-By: Michael Johnson <johnsomor@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ic95111d09e38b3f44fd6c85d0bcf0355c21ef545

commit_message:
Make it possible to depend on the data

In adding support for consuming this data to keystoneauth, there was
pushback to the idea of a data sync and it was instead suggested to make
it possible to pip install / depend on the data. This adds a trivial
python module that will return the contents of the json.

Hopefully this does not make the file contents harder for other folks to
consume. We could almost certainly include other scaffolding for other
languages if that would be similarly helpful.

Change-Id: I84ba134c94722a90c95df390dd5d832f8b666af4

commit_message:
Use wait_until_true in UT

Intermittent failure of test_advertise_withdraw_routes can be
observed. It might be because the threads are asynchronous, and
sometimes background tread doesn't get scheduled on time.

Using wait_until_true to make the test more tolerant to out-sync.

Change-Id: I9ec19a3cfb219a5d6d80d34d52744146a2f939f1
Closes-Bug: #1688242
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/31/462531/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from dragonflow.tests.common import utils as test_utils test_utils.wait_until_true( lambda: self.bgp_service.bgp_driver.advertise_route.called, cfg.CONF.df_bgp.pulse_interval * 2, 1) test_utils.wait_until_true( lambda: self.bgp_service.bgp_driver.withdraw_route.called, cfg.CONF.df_bgp.pulse_interval * 2, 1)
deleted_lines: # Give fixed interval another round. eventlet.sleep(cfg.CONF.df_bgp.pulse_interval + 1) # Give fixed interval another round. eventlet.sleep(cfg.CONF.df_bgp.pulse_interval + 1)

commit_message:
Fix error getting segment_id in linux DHCP driver

A recent change [1] added code to the linux DHCP driver
to check the subnet segment_id attribute when adding
extra host routes for a subnet.  I have seen both
KeyError and AttributeError failures in various check
jobs lately since there is no guarantee all subnets
have this attribute.  Be safer by using getattr().

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/438171/

Related-bug: #1668154

Change-Id: I96bea4edab4c96f2ca28ba854f6ca8d4ab4df5f5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/09/462209/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: segment_id = getattr(subnet, 'segment_id', None) for s in self.network.subnets: sub_segment_id = getattr(s, 'segment_id', None) if (s.ip_version == 4 and s.cidr != subnet.cidr and sub_segment_id == segment_id): host_routes.append("%s,0.0.0.0" % s.cidr)
deleted_lines: host_routes.extend(["%s,0.0.0.0" % (s.cidr) for s in self.network.subnets if (s.ip_version == 4 and s.cidr != subnet.cidr and s.segment_id == subnet.segment_id)])

subject: Use dict arg values for unicode checks in ContextFormatter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-04 20:59:21.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/tests/unit/test_log.py', 'oslo_log/formatters.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.log/commit/72e5c3c1e258589957011506c36dd8af0a481513', 'message': "Use dict arg values for unicode checks in ContextFormatter

In ContextFormatter.format(), for python2 it checks each arg to
determine whether unicode should be used for the format message.
The problem is the code assumes the args are a list, when they can
also be a dict, for example:

  LOG.info('%(thing)s', {'thing': '...'})

and in that case, the dict keys were implicitly being used for the
checks. The checks will always pass on string dict keys, so the
format message gets converted to unicode even though the corresponding
args will ultimately fail decoding to unicode. Then, the logging fails
with:

  UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xc6 in
  position 0: ordinal not in range(128)

when the unicode format message causes an implicit conversion attempt
of the args to unicode [1].

This adds a check for the args type and uses the dict values for the
unicode checks so that dict args with values that fail decoding will
have: should_use_unicode = False.

Closes-Bug: #1580728

[1] https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/2e576f5/Lib/logging/__init__.py#L338

Change-Id: I8c479e507efcf8acd3e3faa4a702fa6e1f18772f
"}]
commit_message:
Use dict arg values for unicode checks in ContextFormatter

In ContextFormatter.format(), for python2 it checks each arg to
determine whether unicode should be used for the format message.
The problem is the code assumes the args are a list, when they can
also be a dict, for example:

  LOG.info('%(thing)s', {'thing': '...'})

and in that case, the dict keys were implicitly being used for the
checks. The checks will always pass on string dict keys, so the
format message gets converted to unicode even though the corresponding
args will ultimately fail decoding to unicode. Then, the logging fails
with:

  UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xc6 in
  position 0: ordinal not in range(128)

when the unicode format message causes an implicit conversion attempt
of the args to unicode [1].

This adds a check for the args type and uses the dict values for the
unicode checks so that dict args with values that fail decoding will
have: should_use_unicode = False.

Closes-Bug: #1580728

[1] https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/2e576f5/Lib/logging/__init__.py#L338

Change-Id: I8c479e507efcf8acd3e3faa4a702fa6e1f18772f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.log refs/changes/35/462735/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_dict_args_with_unicode(self): msg = '%(thing)s' arg = {'thing': '\xc6\x91\xc6\xa1\xc6\xa1'} self.log.info(msg, arg) self.assertIn(arg['thing'], self.stream.getvalue())

commit_message:
Fix the container.cpu is None in cpu_filter

Fix container do not specify the --cpu, then cpu_filter will

commit_message:
Remove keystone v2.0 vim test

The v2.0 keystone API is deprecated and not maintained now.
No need to test the 2.0 vim.

Closes-bug: 1687873

subject: Corrected max secs for concurrent trans retries
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-26 17:50:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/4214f0d0d5135079e65d0c8d0925d5b155a62e3d', 'message': "Use intended retry delays

The retrying library inexplicably measures delays in milliseconds, although
it doesn't bother to document this anywhere, despite the fact that nowhere
in standard Python is time measured in milliseconds, since it is duck-typed
and functions like sleep() can take both integers and floats as an
argument.

I'm pretty certain we intended to put a max 2s delay here, not a max 2ms
delay.

This was most likely meant as a max 2s delay here, not a max 2ms
delay.

Also includes a related change: when retries for metadata updates are
attempted, make sure we do not have a stale value of the atomic_key
(otherwise we'll just inevitably hit the ConcurrentTransaction issue).

Co-Authored-By: Crag Wolfe <cwolfe@redhat.com>
Partial-Bug: #1651768
Change-Id: Ie56e0e4ff93633db1f4752859d2b2a9506922911

commit_message:
Corrected max secs for concurrent trans retries

This was most likely meant as a max 2s delay here, not a max 2ms
delay.

Also includes a related change: when retries for metadata updates are
attempted, make sure we do not have a stale value of the atomic_key
(otherwise we'll just inevitably hit the ConcurrentTransaction issue).

Co-Authored-By: Crag Wolfe <cwolfe@redhat.com>
Partial-Bug: #1651768
Change-Id: Ie56e0e4ff93633db1f4752859d2b2a9506922911

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-03 17:18:17.000000000', 'files': ['functions.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate/commit/3a21366743d6624fb5c51588fcdb26f818fbd8b5', 'message': "Make syslog.txt be more constrained

Change-Id: I3e72a88ca46feb2ee211186066c63697a1931dcf
"}]
commit_message:
Make syslog.txt be more constrained

Now that many things are ending up in the journal, make the syslog.txt
be a trimmed set of topics. At the same time, expand what's in the
native journal files so that we can pull in more topics later.

Change-Id: I3e72a88ca46feb2ee211186066c63697a1931dcf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/31/462231/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The journal contains everything running under systemd, we'll # build an old school version of the syslog with just the # kernel and sudo messages. sudo journalctl \ -t kernel \ -t sudo \ --no-pager \ --since="$(cat $BASE/log-start-timestamp.txt)" \ # for later searching, makes a class of debugging much # easier. This intentionally includes everything, not just # devstack services. sudo journalctl -o export | \
deleted_lines: # the journal gives us syslog() and kernel output, so is like # a concatenation of the above. sudo journalctl --no-pager \ --since="$(cat $BASE/log-start-timestamp.txt)" \ # for later searching, makes a class of debugging much easier. sudo journalctl -o export --unit "devstack@*-*" | \

subject: bump neutron-lib to 1.6.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-04 15:08:55.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/6a34b5a22d3ecd16d4739857c727cdd51e881a62', 'message': "bump neutron-lib to 1.6.0

The upper constraints for neutron-lib have already been bumped for 1.6.0
in Ic5f6099a871a58bbc571fb40de48f7d3178fce7d, but we'd like to see the
requirement change propagated into all consumers so that we can begin
using the changes in neutron-lib between 1.4.0 and 1.6.0. This patch
bumps neutron-lib to 1.6.0 so consuming requirements.txt will be updated
allowing us to use the latest release in neutron and other networking
projects.

Change-Id: I16c22053456d02a83f27b42d6649c1180efedade
"}]
commit_message:
bump neutron-lib to 1.6.0

The upper constraints for neutron-lib have already been bumped for 1.6.0
in Ic5f6099a871a58bbc571fb40de48f7d3178fce7d, but we'd like to see the
requirement change propagated into all consumers so that we can begin
using the changes in neutron-lib between 1.4.0 and 1.6.0. This patch
bumps neutron-lib to 1.6.0 so consuming requirements.txt will be updated
allowing us to use the latest release in neutron and other networking
projects.

Change-Id: I16c22053456d02a83f27b42d6649c1180efedade

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-25 17:49:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tacker/commit/72f1e0ffb7a01ab760c01980dac8e2ec37215b41', 'message': "Tacker server throws exception when member action contains UPDATE string.

When an member action contains a 'update' string, Tacker server checks
target to contain ATTRIBUTES_TO_UPDATE. Since this is an UPDATE action,
Tacker server checks for 'update' string in action attribute and this
raises an exception, KeyError: 'attributes_to_update'.

This change fixes this exception.

commit_message:
'update-vim' - server side changes.

update to VIM attributes like, 'name', 'description' and 'is_default'
must not require config file.

This change addresses this issue.

client-side-fix: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/450100/

Closes-Bug: #1637360
Change-Id: I12b57f3a60e5a771f607de965f2ea8f4f37cdbf6

commit_message:
Add openstack_integration::cloudkitty

This patch adds new class to install and configure
cloudkitty.

Change-Id: I7d94641dacb7ff3501dcd7f8cd32401c0e7096bb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/09/457209/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Configure the Cloudkitty service # # [*collector*] # (Optional) Data collector. # Defaults to 'ceilometer'. # class openstack_integration::cloudkitty ( $collector = 'ceilometer', ) { include ::openstack_integration::config include ::openstack_integration::params rabbitmq_user { 'cloudkitty': admin => true, password => 'an_even_bigger_secret', provider => 'rabbitmqctl', require => Class['::rabbitmq'], } rabbitmq_user_permissions { 'cloudkitty@/': configure_permission => '.*', write_permission => '.*', read_permission => '.*', provider => 'rabbitmqctl', require => Class['::rabbitmq'], } $transport_url = os_transport_url({ 'transport' => 'rabbit', 'host' => $::openstack_integration::config::host, 'port' => $::openstack_integration::config::rabbit_port, 'username' => 'cloudkitty', 'password' => 'an_even_bigger_secret', }) include ::cloudkitty::client class { '::cloudkitty': default_transport_url => $transport_url, notification_transport_url => $transport_url, database_connection => 'mysql+pymysql://cloudkitty:cloudkitty@127.0.0.1/cloudkitty?charset=utf8', } class { '::cloudkitty::db::mysql': password => 'cloudkitty', } class { '::cloudkitty::keystone::auth': public_url => "${::openstack_integration::config::base_url}:8889", internal_url => "${::openstack_integration::config::base_url}:8889", admin_url => "${::openstack_integration::config::base_url}:8889", password => 'a_big_secret', } class {'::cloudkitty::keystone::authtoken': auth_url => $::openstack_integration::config::keystone_admin_uri, auth_uri => $::openstack_integration::config::keystone_auth_uri, password => 'a_big_secret', } include ::cloudkitty::api include ::cloudkitty::ui class {'::cloudkitty::processor': collector => $collector } }

commit_message:
Add networking terms used in Tricricle

1. What is the problem?
There is no unified terms used in Tricricle networking, this
will lead to confusion for the end user.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Add networking terms to ease Tricircle networking automation,
reduce the misunderstanding on the networking guide.

3. What features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to realize
the solution?
None

Change-Id: Iae4f3b997dedc909c11ee89a7e73e1ead9c1c461
Signed-off-by: joehuang <joehuang@huawei.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tricircle refs/changes/89/461589/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. include:: ./networking-terms.rst

commit_message:
Adds a validation test for trait names

Standard trait names should follow the regex "^[A-Z][A-Z0-9]*$". One of the
traits (HW_CPU_X86_AES-NI) erroneously contained a hyphen, so we correct that
and add a test to ensure no future traits wander from the standard trait name
regex.

Luckily, nothing yet is consuming os-traits and so the AES-NI slipup is yet to
have any impact.

Change-Id: I0603bcb4a1038289d2a3b6ce18aa823c7fac0829

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-04 23:13:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-traits/commit/0e3391f737aef513e4be278e793728cafd1da64f', 'message': "Remove 'CUSTOM_NAMESPACE'/'os_traits' from traits

'os_traits' in the list of returned traits because the matching expression in
the list comprehension wasn't filtering out these two module-level string
attributes.

Also removes the name.upper() in symbolize() because that's actually dangerous

commit_message:
Remove 'CUSTOM_NAMESPACE'/'os_traits' from traits

The get_traits() function was erroneously including 'CUSTOM_NAMESPACE' and
'os_traits' in the list of returned traits because the matching expression in
the list comprehension wasn't filtering out these two module-level string
attributes.

Also removes the name.upper() in symbolize() because that's actually dangerous
-- it may make a symbol in os_traits that doesn't actually match the trait name
defined in the submodule. For instance, if someone creates an
os_traits/foo/bar.py module with::

TRAITS = [
    'baz',
]

the name.upper() would make a symbol os_traits.foo.bar.BAZ and
os_traits.FOO_BAR_baz

Change-Id: I8633cb29649ad0ca67f7669fd2b405b55e16258e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-traits refs/changes/58/462758/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: setattr(leaf_mod, name, value) # os_traits.hw.cpu.x86.SSE v.startswith(prefix) and k not in ('CUSTOM_NAMESPACE', 'this_name')
deleted_lines: setattr(leaf_mod, name.upper(), value) # os_traits.hw.cpu.x86.SSE v.startswith(prefix)

commit_message:
remove redundant get_symbol_names() func

The os_traits.get_symbol_names() function implementation was identical to the
os_traits.get_traits() function. Remove it.

Change-Id: I8656d98e51258b641190cfca1da71348ca7b6752
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-traits refs/changes/57/462757/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def get_symbol_names(prefix=None): """Returns the names of symbols of trait strings in the os_traits module, optionally filtered by a supplied prefix. :param prefix: Optional string prefix to filter by. e.g. 'HW_' """ prefix = prefix or "" return [ k for k, v in sys.modules[__name__].__dict__.items() if isinstance(v, six.string_types) and not k.startswith('_') and v.startswith(prefix) ]

Closes-Bug: #1651768
'}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2017-04-22 01:39:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/7885ba664c34f1c267a510eabaa819b39db71777', 'message': "Retry metadata updates if needed

Previously, if a resource attempted to update its metadata but its
view of its atomic_key was stale (often because another signal just
caused the metadata to be updated and incremented the atomic_key), the
resource would throw exception.ConcurrentTransaction.

Now, allow retries where we refresh the value of the db resource's
atomic_key and metadata on each attempt. Sleep randomly between 0 and
1 seconds before each retry to allow for some stagger in the event we
get many signals attempting to update a resource at once.

Change-Id: I15a1289af70576ee735d81b6b8ac2130bdcc657e
Closes-Bug: #1651768
"}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2017-04-26 00:36:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/aa12e87e644e21db5f52e44d934a231f00719280', 'message': "Correctly increment the resource atomic_key after a metadata update

While metadata_set() currently can update the metadata and db
atomic_key as intended, it can leave a heat-engine-resource instance's
._atomic_key with an incorrect value (especially when the db
resource's atomic_key was incremented between retries).

Change-Id: I15a1289af70576ee735d81b6b8ac2130bdcc657e

commit_message:
Correctly increment the resource atomic_key after a metadata update

While metadata_set() currently can update the metadata and db
atomic_key as intended, it can leave a heat-engine-resource instance's
._atomic_key with an incorrect value (especially when the db
resource's atomic_key was incremented between retries).

Change-Id: I15a1289af70576ee735d81b6b8ac2130bdcc657e
Partial-Bug: #1675286

commit_message:
Add absolute path to docker in run_container.

Unit files fail if they don't have the full path to the command, this
commit fixes etcd unit file so it can run. It also handles dockerd just
in case the path could change at some point.

Change-Id: I4c5472ef80c552ff937ceb680b3856ea3d7d88c6
Closes-Bug: 1688346
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/72/462672/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: docker run --name "$name" --detach "$@" "/usr/bin/dockerd --debug=true \

commit_message:
Use plain routes list for os-floating-ip-dns endpoint instead of stevedore

This patch adds os-floating-ip-dns related routes by a plain list, instead
of using stevedore. After all the Nova API endpoints moves to
the plain routes list, the usage of stevedore for API loading will be
removed from Nova.

Partial-implement-blueprint api-no-more-extensions-pike

Change-Id: Id0df46d980c8141e6207d221e9bbe1d31f50aea3

commit_message:
Refactor block-device base functions.

As part of the final steps, refactor the bits belonging
to block device and functions. This is a partial refactor
from I3600c6a3d663c697b59d91bd3fbb5e408af345e4

Change-Id: I7aa4fe0466e44846d8fa3194575d446fe4b5b2e6
Co-Authored-By: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/56/461356/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _config_tree_to_digraph(tconfig, plugin_manager): """Converts a possible tree-like config into a complete digraph""" dconfig = [] for config_entry in tconfig: if len(config_entry) != 1: logger.error("Invalid config entry: more than one key " "on top level [%s]" % config_entry) raise BlockDeviceSetupException( "Top level config must contain exactly one key per entry") logger.debug("Config entry [%s]" % config_entry) config_key = config_entry.keys()[0] config_value = config_entry[config_key] name = config_value['name'] \ if 'name' in config_value else None if config_key not in plugin_manager: dconfig.append(config_entry) else: plugin_manager[config_key].plugin \ .tree_config.config_tree_to_digraph( config_key, config_value, dconfig, name, plugin_manager) return dconfig @staticmethod logger.debug("Create graph [%s]" % config) self.config = self._config_tree_to_digraph(self.config, self.plugin_manager) logger.debug("Config before merge [%s]" % self.config) self.state = {} self.create(self.state, rollback) self.write_state(self.state) if self.state is None: logger.info("State already cleaned - no way to do anything here") return 0 # Deleting must be done in reverse order
deleted_lines: result = {} self.create(result, rollback) # To be compatible with the current implementation, echo the # result to stdout. # If there is no partition needed, pass back directly the # image. if 'root' in result['blockdev']: print("%s" % result['blockdev']['root']['device']) else: print("%s" % result['blockdev']['image0']['device']) self.write_state(result) # To be compatible with the current implementation, echo the # result to stdout. print("%s" % self.state['blockdev']['image0']['image']) if dg is None: return 0 if dg is None: return 0

commit_message:
Add functional api tests for node resource class

Add following tests:
  Create new node with specified longest name of resource class.
  Update existing node with specified resource class.
  Show resource class field of specified node.
  List nodes of specified resource class only.
  Get detailed nodes list of specified resource class only.
  Try to create a node with too long resource class name.
  Try to update a node with too long resource class name.
  Try to create a node with resource class using older api version.
  Try to update a node with resource class using older api version.
  Try to list nodes with resource class using older api version.

Closes-Bug: #1668605
Change-Id: If412a2aeab2ab457f04067cf296cac80b4378482

commit_message:
Remove configuring deprecated ceilometer services

Ceilometer collector and API are deprecated and disabled by default.
Lets not include them in the configuration.

Change-Id: I09bcc75f93d8a8998df4c2238298e229b89e26a4

commit_message:
scenario001: rework telemetry services

Ubuntu and Redhat/Centos doesn't have all telemetry packages.

Instead of checking everywhere if we are on Ubuntu or Redhat/Centos,
this change uses a boolean 'enable_telemetry_legacy'.

If true, ::openstack_integration::ceilometer will configure ceilometer
with legacy services/configuration (without panko/gnocchi). If false,
Gnocchi and Panko backend is used.

scenario001 set it to true for Ubuntu and false for Redhat/Centos.

This centralize the kind of ceilometer deployement in one place.

This change also drops the now useless collector configuration and
configure the notification agent correctly instead.

Change-Id: If229829975d4f25ca0a2a3c6c93e674204d71dc2

make sure ceph pool exists before running gnocchi (dbsync & services) Exec['create-gnocchi'] -> Exec['gnocchi-db-sync'] class { '::gnocchi::statsd': archive_policy_name => 'high', flush_delay => '100', # commit_message:
Pin puppetlabs-corosync to v5.0.0

They pushed a tag called test-tag so our tooling now tries to bump to
this tag because it thinks it's the latest one. We don't want this tag.

Let's ping to v5.0.0 for now.

Change-Id: I494e78772b915f1e6999868e0c54d586c56c4f75

commit_message:
Remove log translations from neutron-lbaas

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: Ia323fc58c66c645fca0254ace01a8849ce239525

commit_message:
Ensures that OneView nodes are free for use by Ironic

Following the requirement. The validation is used within
"OneViewPower.validate". As a result it enforces that a machine
is owned by OneView, thus it cannot be powered on or off by the
Ironic driver. Raising an exception when the node is owned by
Oneview.

Conflicts:
	ironic/drivers/modules/oneview/power.py
	ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/oneview/test_deploy_utils.py

Change-Id: Ibf500577b7a3b5976fd49fd217c1be3d3e9c0f46
Closes-Bug: 1627034
Co-Authored-By: Stenio Araujo <steniaraujo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
(cherry picked from commit 2505cb58f74b05c534a6a513080919063cc65fa9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/09/429009/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - Fixes an issue with ironic being able to change the power state of nodes currently in use by OneView.

commit_message:
nova: Use endpoint_override instead of deprecated bypass_url

novaclient deprecated 'bypass_url' argument in Ocata and
the use of 'endpoint_override' is recommended.

Change-Id: I88bb974fa11452d1262779b75444ba6d7ad44ebb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/17/462217/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: endpoint_override=nova_url)
deleted_lines: bypass_url=nova_url)
